01944d26-e9e6-730a-917e-defe1528c42e.name: Jenny
01944d26-e9e6-730a-917e-defe1528c42e.abandon: Okay bye! Come see me if I can help.

conversation.phrase: Welcome to District Con! Are you here to register?
Great! You're all set. Here's your badge!
Oh, it looks like you're already registered and have your badge. Enjoy the con!
Do you need a map of the venue?
Oh, it looks like you already have a map. Have you looked at it?
No problem, here you go!
Okay, enjoy the con!
Hello again! I see you still have your badge. Did you need a map of the venue?
Nice to see you again! Looks like you have your badge and map, you should head down to the conference center and check it out. Bye!
Looks like you checked out the logo, do you like it?
Glad to hear it! Enjoy the con
Sorry to hear that.
Have you ever listened to the Dead Presidents?
You gotta do that! They have a bunch of their stuff at Som Records.
Nah, I mean have you _really_ *listened* to them?
Righteous. Later!
I love the Dead Presidents, don't you?
Oh, no way! You need to listen to their stuff. I think Som Records has some.
All right, all right.
When's the last time you listened to the Dead Presidents?
Woah. Okay, well... you know Som Records has, like, all their stuff on classic vinyl. Check it out.
Hey new friend, have you made it over to Som records yet? They have the ultimate disco vinyl collection, biggest you've ever seen, some of it basically brand new! Always so much fun.
Awesome, awesome. Have you seen their disco collection?
Oh wow, you should really check it out. The collection is only for hard core disco fans, tho. They keep it in a back room. You should try to go there. Do have the password?
Ah, well I don't usually give this away, but you look pretty cool. I'll give you a hint: 17 8 2 29 30 10 16 6 32 22 11
That's cool, very cool. My pals here aren't into DisCo so much, but I can dig it. Enjoy the con!
Didn't we already talk? I think I gave you a hint to something. Look at it closely.
So you found my calling card... nice skillz. Just one question for you: what's my handle?

met: Heh, close, but what's that spell?

conversation.phrase: Doesn't look like you actually did the leg work here, friend. You need to find where I hid my calling card.
Killer. Here's my number in case you need it in the future.
You already got my number, that's all I have for you.
Are you liking the game so far?
Glad to hear it! Have you found all of the game locations?
Sorry to hear that... but hey, it is year zero after all.
Wow! You're some kinda 1337 hacker, aren't you? Here, take a challenge coin.
Hmm, I don't think so... maybe you should find me and I can give you a hint.
No problem, the game is hard on purpose! Come find me IRL if you want a hint.
Looks like you already got my challenge coin. I wonder, have you seen my code?
Wow, nicely done. Here's a cool Node.js sticker for you!
Hmm, you haven't found the _server_ code yet. I think it's posted online somewhere...
Don't worry, you can keep searching even after the con!
Oh thank goodness, I found someone with a map! I'm trying to get to an event, maybe you can help me?
Oh, okay. No problem. Thanks anyway, maybe someone can fill in for me.
Hey wait, that's not a metro map! I need to find someone with a map of the metro stations. You might be able to ask the station manager for one.

I'm supposed to be speaking at DistrictCon, but can't remember how to get there. I think I'm on the orange line, can you tell me what metro station is closest in walking distance to the Yours Truly Hotel?

met: Hmm, are you sure? That doesn't look right on the map.

conversation.phrase: Oh, thank you! I know it's not much, but here's a custom sticker for helping me. I'd better hurry, but see you at the con!
Thank you again for helping me. I hope you enjoy the sticker!
Do you need help finding something?
No problem, where do you need to go?
Okay, did you need something else?
No worries, have a good day.
Hmm, looks like have a metro station map, that's good. Did you need help find somewhere specifically?
Sure thing, here's a metro station map.

Hmm, I think the closest station to that hotel is Foggy Bottom. Take the orange line that way. Have a good day!
(You can probably just say 'go to the Yours Truly hotel')

Ah, I think I heard about that event. It's at the Yours Truly hotel, right? You can take the orange line to Foggy Bottom to get there.
(You can probably just say 'go to the Yours Truly hotel')

The best way to get there is taking the green line to the U Street station, it's just a couple blocks from there.
(You can probably just say 'go to Som Records')
Sorry, not sure how to get there. But maybe a map would help. Do you need one?
Oh hi! Oh my goodness, thank you so much for coming to DistrictCon's Year Zero! Hey, do you have a minute to help me out?
No problem, enjoy the con!
I think someone may have broken into the DisCo web server Any chance you could look through the logs for any clues?
Awesome, I've already sent the log file to you! Hope you enjoy the con!

You found our hacker?! Nice job! Oooh, it was leetBeats? That character is always up to something, but they're harmless... mostly. I'm going to have to give them a talking to. Thanks again for the help, and enjoy the con.
You did it!

Hello! This is pretty freakin' cool, huh? People working together, users code-ing side by side, 1+1, making shit happen! I love watchin' these folks. One of the teams had to try like 32 different iterations of some script just get paest one firewall rule. You know, I think they found something that they haven't been able to crack yet. You wanna help out?
No problem, but you should come back and try! Maybe bring a friend.

This one is a bit tricky. You should find a friend to work with. Theraes lots of people here to choose from, more than two hundred, but definitely less than five hundred, I think. Do you have someone? If so, tell me their handle.

not: Sorry, but I'll need to be talking to both of you at the same time. Invite your friend to join us here and chat me up. Make sure you're connected to them in this world!

conversation.phrase: Okay, so here's the deal: the team found this data on a foreign server simply labelled 'secret'. I know, obvious, but aes the saying goes, 'hackers gotta hack'. The team that found it has already moved on, they figure they can decrypt the data any time, but maybe you two can help? Here's the data, did you copy it down?
Awesome, good luck!
Oh wow, you figured it out! Amazing! Enjoy the rest of the con.
Hi! Welcome to Call Your Mother! Are you here with the conference?
Geez, I was just trying to be friendly. Fine, what kind of bagel do you want?
Aw, gee, we're out of... everything. Maybe come back later.
Oh, no? I hear it's pretty swell. You should check it out. So, you want a bagel?
Here you go, enjoy!
Okay, well, there's a line building up, so...
That's neat! Some day maybe I'll get into hacking stuff. Is it hard?
Oh, okay. Well, there's a line building up, here's your bagel. Enjoy!
Really? I woulda thought it'd be tough. Maybe I should try some day. Here's your bagel, enjoy!
Looks like you already have a bagel, enjoy!
Welcome to the policy room! We're in between sessions right now, but I was actually just researching some stuff for a later session. Any chance you could help me run down some facts?
I understand, feel free to stay for one of our open sessions!

Whew, thanks a ton. Okay, there's been a lot of talk about post-quantum crypto lately, but I'm trying to find out which federal agency was on the hook for researching products that support it. I think there was something very recently on that. Can you tell me which agency it was?

met: Hmm, I think that was the top level agency, but which organization in DHS was it?

triggers: cyber security and infrastructure security agency

met: Hmm, I don't think that was it.

conversation.phrase: Of course! Thanks. Okay, what was the number of that Executive Order?

met: Hmm, I don't think that was it.

conversation.phrase: Got it, thanks. Someone else was asking which law it was that basically makes unauthorized hacking illegal. Basically, accessing a system 'without authorization'. I know we wanted to look at how we can still responsibly disclose things we find, so I wanted to start a conversation about that law. Can you tell me which law that was?

triggers: computer fraud and abuse act of 1986

met: Hmm, I don't think that was it.

conversation.phrase: Oh wow, thank you so much! You're being so helpful. Okay, last one, I promise. I'm trying to figure out which part of the US Code allows people in the intel and military orgs to hack other countries. Can you tell me which US Code title that is?

met: Hmm, I don't think that was it.

conversation.phrase: I feel so much better about this next session now! Thanks again for your help. I know it's not much, but here, take this!
Thanks again for your help earlier! I think the Policy room activities are going really well.

Hi! I go by NOPResearcher, thanks for stopping by. The Red Team Village is focuses on training the art of critical thinking, collaboration, and strategy in offensive security. The RTV brings together information security professionals to share new tactices and techniques in offensive security. You could spend your entire DistrictCon engaged in introductory workshops or even challenge yourself in immersive CTF competition to put those newly obtained skills to the test! Check us out at https://redteamvillage.io

Welcome to the other side of the hacking mirror! I'm muteki, and this is the Blue Team Village. It's a community bult for and by defenders. It's also a place to gather, talk, share, and learn from each other about the latest tools, technologies, and tactics our community can use to detect attackers and prevent them from achieving their goals. Check us out online at https://blueteamvillage.org

Got the GUTS to hack the code of life? Hi, I'm v3ga, and this is the Biohacking Village! Dive into the Biohacking Village and test your DNA - whether it's in the lab or in your curiosity. Who knows, you might just uncover some twisted truths! You can also check us out online at https://villageb.io
Hello, thank you for stopping by. I always enjoy meeting people dedicated to making our country safer, and increasingly that means ensuring our safety and security in cyberspace.
Hi! I'm one of General Nakasone's students, nice to meet you! I'm doing some research for an article and need to check some biographic data. Can you tell me where he got his Bachelor's degree?

met: Hmm, I don't think that's it.

conversation.phrase: No worries, thanks anyway!
That was it! Thanks. Hey, maybe this will help you during the con: 1:017e87fc

Hey there, I'm one of General Nakasone's students. I'm doing some research for an article and need to check something. Before he became the Director of Vanderbilt's Institute for National Security I think he spoke at some Summit here. Can you tell me what that was?

triggers: summit on modern conflict and emerging threats

met: Hmm, I don't think that's it.

conversation.phrase: No problem, enjoy the con!
Ah, yes! Thank you. You might need this later: 2-23ae
Hey there, I'm one of General Nakasone's students. I'm doing some research for an article and need to check something. What year did Nakasone take over as the Commander for USCYBERCOM and the NSA?

met: Hmm, I don't think that's it.

conversation.phrase: No problem, enjoy the con!
Of course, of course, thanks! Hey, you might need this for something: 3-7fb1
Hey there, I'm one of General Nakasone's students. I'm doing some research for an article and need to check something. Can you tell me what rank Paul Nakasone's father held?

met: Hmm, I don't think that's it.

conversation.phrase: No problem, enjoy the con!
Right! I think I knew that... In any case, I think you might need this later: 4-8ecc
Hey there, I'm one of General Nakasone's students. I'm doing some research for an article and need to check something. When did General Nakasone receive hist first star?

met: Hmm, I don't think that's it.

conversation.phrase: No problem, enjoy the con!
Yes, that's it. Thank you! Here, maybe you can use this: 5-43f851b6dd01

Oh hey. Uh, could you do me a favor? I need a another *hand mic* in here for Q&A, but I don't really have time to run over and get one. There should be an extra one in the Junkyard room. Can you get it for me?
Uh, okay. I guess I'll send someone else.
Thanks a ton, just bring it back here. I'll owe you one!
You found the mic! But I actually found one under the table here, too. You just hang onto that one for while, cool? But hey, I still owe you one. Thanks again!

Hi! I hope you enjoyed the opening session of DistrictCon! Zero-click exploits are pretty crazy. You know, I think someone left a usb drive laying around here somewhere with some new malware on it. Have you seen the usb drive?
Hmm, okay. I think I saw one of the staff with it last. Maybe they took it to the staff room.
Oh wow! Did you already reverse engineer it? Well done!
Oh good, well, I think it might be fun to try and reverse engineer that. Just have to get into the rhythm. Good luck!
Gotta find halvar, seen him?
Darn, I'm going to stay here in case he shows up. I know he was going to try to take the metro here, I hope he didn't get lost.
Oh really?! That's great! Hopefully he'll show up soon, I know the metro system can be confusing.
Thank you so much for helping to get Halvar here in time for his session!

Yo, what's up? Just tryin' ta get this Nintendo DS to crack for me. The wifi's only WEP, so that part ain't hard, but then I gotta move from there to the processing core. Honestly, having a second one of these would really help. Later.
Oh snap! You found another DS unit? What're the odds?! Hey, I don't spose you could lemme have it? I could trade you for it!
Yeah, ok... that makes sense. I guess I'll just keep hackin at this thing.
Dang, that is so awesome, thank you! Of course, it's still yours, I'll get it back to you soon. Here, take this, I have two anyway.
Sup? I'm still workin here, just trying to get... this... to... work...
Welcome to Labyrinth Games! How can I help you? Maybe you want to *solve* our puzzle? Or if you need a specific item, just ask for it by name!

triggers: i want to solve the puzzle

met: Hmm, I'm not sure about that item, but you're free to roam our shelves!

conversation.phrase: Okay, well feel free to look around! Just come talk to me if you need something specific.
Welcome to Labyrinth Games! It looks like you already solved our puzzle, well done! If you need a specific item, just ask for it by name!

met: Hmm, I'm not sure about that, but you're free to roam our shelves!

conversation.phrase: Oh great! Okay, what do you think the answer is?

met: Sorry, that's not it. What do you think the puzzle solution is?

conversation.phrase: Oh, the original Nintendo DS? Yeah, it's pretty cool. We actually just got a small box of those from another gaming store that shut down and found them in a back closet! You're welcome to buy one!
That's right! Good job, here's your reward!
